vague_description: Maximize profits by determining the optimal amount of each mixed candy product that uses the available resources.
detailed_description: A candy store mixes regular candy and sour candy to prepare two products, regular mix and sour surprise mix. Each kilogram of the regular mix contains \var{RegCandyRegMix} kg of regular candy and \var{SourCandyRegMix} kg of sour candy. The profit per kilogram of the regular mix is $\var{ProfitRegMix}. Each kilogram of the sour surprise mix contains \var{RegCandySourMix} kg of regular candy and \var{SourCandySourMix} kg of sour candy. The profit per kilogram of the sour surprise mix is $\var{ProfitSourMix}. The candy store has \var{TotalRegCandy} kg of regular candy and \var{TotalSourCandy} kg of sour candy available. How many kilograms of each type of candy mix should be created to maximize profits?
target_objective: Maximize the total profit from the sale of regular mix and sour surprise mix
target_constraints: The amount of regular mix and sour surprise mix should be non-negative
The sum of regular candy used in both mixes cannot exceed TotalRegCandy kg
The sum of sour candy used in both mixes cannot exceed TotalSourCandy kg
Each kilogram of the regular mix contains RegCandyRegMix kg of regular candy and SourCandyRegMix kg of sour candy
Each kilogram of the sour surprise mix contains RegCandySourMix kg of regular candy and SourCandySourMix kg of sour candy
target_parameters: Amount of regular candy in each kilogram of the regular mix
Amount of sour candy in each kilogram of the regular mix
Profit per kilogram of the regular mix
Amount of regular candy in each kilogram of the sour surprise mix
Amount of sour candy in each kilogram of the sour surprise mix
Profit per kilogram of the sour surprise mix
Total amount of regular candy available
Total amount of sour candy available
